snippet: The administration acknowledged its own role in the proliferation of tests, and urged schools to make exams less onerous and more purposeful.
abstract: Obama administration affirms emphasis on high-stakes testing in public schools has gone too far, acknowledging its own role in creating situation now strongly protested by teachers and parents; calls for schools to limit time students spend taking tests and to endeavor to make tests less burdensome and more purposeful; some warn statement risks creating confusion around role of tests in schools.
lead_paragraph: The administration acknowledged its own role in the proliferation of tests, and urged schools to make exams less onerous and more purposeful.

headline.print_headline: White House Moves to Limit School Testing
headline.main: Obama Administration Calls for Limits on Testing in Schools
